• 2 cups ground Egusi (melon seeds)
• 1 cup palm oil
• 1-2 lbs assorted meat (beef, goat meat, cow tripe)
• 1-2 pieces fish (stockfish or dried fish)
• 1/4 cup ground crayfish
• 1 large onion, chopped
• 2 cups fresh spinach or bitter leaves, chopped
• 1-2 Scotch bonnet or habanero peppers, chopped
• 2 bell peppers, chopped (optional)
• 2 tomatoes, chopped (optional)
• 2 stock cubes (Maggi or Knorr)
• Salt to taste
• Water or meat stock as needed
• 1-2 tablespoons locust beans (iru or ogiri, optional)

1. Prepare the Ingredients:

• Clean and cut the assorted meat into bite-sized pieces.
• Rinse the fish and set aside.
• If using dried fish, soak in hot water to soften and then debone.
• Chop the onions, peppers, and tomatoes (if using).

2. Cook the Meat:

• In a large pot, add the assorted meat, a chopped onion, stock cubes, and salt. Add enough water to cover the meat and cook until tender. Set the meat aside but keep the stock.

3. Prepare the Egusi:

• In a bowl, mix the ground egusi with a small amount of water to form a thick paste.

4. Cook the Egusi Soup:

• In another large pot, heat the palm oil over medium heat.
• Add the chopped onions and sauté until translucent.
• Add the ground crayfish, locust beans (if using), and chopped peppers. Sauté for a few minutes.
• Add the egusi paste by spoonfuls into the pot. Stir well and let it fry for about 10-15 minutes. Stir frequently to prevent burning.

5. Combine and Simmer:

• Add the cooked meat and fish to the pot.
• Pour in the meat stock and additional water if needed to reach your desired consistency.
• Stir well and let the soup simmer for about 10-15 minutes.
• Add the chopped spinach or bitter leaves and let it cook for another 5 minutes.

6. Final Seasoning:

• Taste and adjust the seasoning with salt and additional stock cubes if needed.

7. Serve:

• Egusi soup is typically served with pounded yam, fufu, eba, or any other type of swallow (starchy side dish).
